page.title: 01Description of Our Area.
page.content: In our area the highest land is in the south west with parts over 122 metres. The land slopes to the valleys of the {River Derwent}in the north and the { {River Cocker}in the east. There are three small streams crossing our area. {Simonscales Beck}and{Paddle Beck}are tributaries of the{River Cocker. {Eller Beck}is a tributary of the{River {Derwent.}Towards the middle of our section is Dubbs Moss, a wet area which is now a Nature Reserve. There is part of the town{Cockermouth}in the N.E., the village of{Eaglesfield}in the South, and the village of{Brigham} in the N.W. The population of{ {Cockermouth}is about 7000,{Brigham}is 850 and{Eaglesfield}is 250.The A66 a trunk road from Keswick and Penrith (M6) to Workington goes across our section from east to west round Cockermouth.
